channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Poor road surface, 25th February
item.description:
Poor road surface on this busy road, needs to be checked out and scheduled for surface repair asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 22 High Street, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fallen manhole cover in road and potholes along the road., 25th February
item.description:
There are a couple of fallen manhole covers in the road directly where your tyres run in a narrow part of the carriageway, making the issue hard to avoid. Also there is a poor road surface and potholes along this road - into and along New Barn Lane. This is a busy road and needs to well maintained.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Tatchley Mews Tatchley Lane, Prestbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned since Sat 19th Feb, 23rd February
item.description:
It is parked in the hedge, with a Deliveroo bag inside. The mobile number left in the drivers seat does not exist and it looks like it has been abandoned for good. It has been here for 5 days now and is blocking parking and access in and out of houses. Will most likely block bin collections too. Not good enough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 16 Butterfield Court, Bishops Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree leaning into road, 23rd February
item.description:
During recent winds a tree covered with ivy is leaning into the carriageway causing vehicles and cyclists to swerve around it when coming up Manor Road. This tree could eventually fall completely into the road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Manor Court, Swindon Village

item.title: Building Disintegrating in recent storms, 22nd February
item.description:
This building is in a field adjacent to Stantons Drive close to the village allotments. In the recent storms over the past few days it has started to disintegrate. Half of the roof has flipped over and the other tin sheets are flapping in the wind. If there is a repeat of the high winds the loose sheets could rip free and be carried into the road it backs onto. This road, although a dead end leads to the public footpath and is in regular use by walkers and allotmenters. A flying sheet of tin could have disastrous consequences. This is probably the resposibility of the farmer but he needs alerting.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Bramble Cottage Stantons Drive, Swindon Village
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street lighting out zoons court roundabout, 22nd February
item.description:
ZOONS COURT ROUNDABOUT - Enquiry 11354880 Inbox Street Lighting Enquiries <streetlightingenquiries@gloucestershire.gov.uk> 21 Feb 2022, 15:09 (18 hours ago) to me Good afternoon M Protherough Thank you for your urgent enquiry. I confirm that these are not Gloucestershire County Council assets. They are owned and maintained by National Highways England Area 2. Please report the outages direct to https://nationalhighways.co.uk/about-us/contact-us/ They will allocate an enquiry number and raise the faults for you and should communicate directly with yourself. We have no authority over how or when they do their repairs. I’m sorry that we are not able to help in this instance. Kind Regards Bee Patrick Customer Liaison Officer Gloucester Street Lighting Team Ddi: 01452 583442 Streetlightingenquiries@gloucestershire.gov.uk From: Gloucestershire County Council - Production [mailto:GLOCS_Production_TaskProcessor@OnDemand.confirm.co.uk] Sent: 19 February 2022 12:50 To: Street Lighting Enquiries <streetlightingenquiries@gloucestershire.gov.uk> Subject: Street Lighting Request Received - Enquiry 11354880 Please do not reply to this message. This is an automated message and responses are not monitored An enquiry has been received for the street lighting service. Enquiry Number: 11354880 Current Status: New Enquiry - Street Lighting Logged By: CRM User On: 19/02/2022 At: 12:48:03 Street: ZOONS COURT ROUNDABOUT Ward: Hucclecote Ward Subject: SL-Street Light Outage Report Description: Streetlight Light is permanently out THIS IS A FATAL ACCIDENT WAITING TO HAPPEN! All of the streetlamps have been out of action for months. Now we have signs to say street lighting out of use. After witnessing a 'beached' vehicle on the roundabout last week, I have witnessed on three separate occasions this week where drivers have not been aware they were approaching a roundabout in the dark, and have had to brake hard before negotiating the junction. One skidding to 90° to direction of travel! THIS ROUNDABOUT SHOULD BE WELL LIT WITH UP-TO-DATE LED BULBS FITTED. PLEASE DON'T WAIT UNTIL THERE IS A FATALITY. THE COST HERE IS UNIMAGINABLE TO THE FAMILIES INVOLVED, AND HUGE TO THE TAXPAYER VIA THE EMERGENCY SERVICES THAT WILL BE INVOLVED. Location: Additional Comments: Easting: 387427.78 Northing: 218113.2
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): A417, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipped Black Bags and other Rubbish, 21st February
item.description:
The location is the Aggs Hill Road going into Cotswold Way Road in a Passing Place / Field Gate entrance on the right hand side going towards the BurntOak Crossroads. About 4 to 6 Black Bags of waste and some other rubbish have been fly tipped here. Please can it be cleared up quite urgently as the high winds have started to blow it about mainly onto the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
